content.text: Get ready, Buckeyes—this fall is packed with opportunities to explore, connect, and launch your professional future.

When:Wednesday September 3rd, 1 p.m. –5 p.m.Where:Ohio Union, Griffin Grand BallroomWho:All majors welcome—employers want critical thinkers, communicators, and problem-solvers of every background!Curious about careers in tech, data, or analytics—but not sure where to begin? This fair is your starting point. With more than50+ employersready to talk, it’s a chance to explore internships, ask questions and discover how your skills translate to in-demand roles.What to expect:
Learn what skills are in demand (no experience needed!)
Learn what skills are in demand (no experience needed!)
See how your degree fits—but curiosity is your key.
See how your degree fits—but curiosity is your key.
ARTSSCI 2000: Designing Your Career Experience( Course Number 36614 )

Are you unsure about whether an internship is right for you? Do you know how to find career-building opportunities (like internships) that align with your values and goals? Are you considering graduate school, but not sure how to prepare? This course provides you with practical tools, resources, and strategies to get the most out of any career-building opportunity.
ARTSSCI 3000: Designing Your Life After College( Course Number 36615 )

Could you use help creating a thoughtful career plan? This course connects you directly with career resources, tools, and mentors, and helps you identify the skills or experiences you need to be competitive in the world of work. You will complete a micro-internship, industry-specific course, or certification that will give you the competitive edge you need to break into your field of interest.
ARTSSCI 4000: Designing Your Career Launch( Course Number 36616 )

This course prepares you for your post-graduate career by offering real-world experience while still in college. You’ll work directly with industry partners to develop solutions to real challenges, building employer confidence in your professional potential. By the end, you'll have a comprehensive industry project to showcase on your resume, cover letter, and in interviews. If you've taken other career development courses, this one will push you further by refining your career materials with insights from mentors, faculty, and peers. The instructor will tailor content to your career journey, with alternative assignments available as needed.To learn more, contact Assistant Dean TriciaZelaya-Leon.1@osu.edu for more information.
Have a quick question? Want resume feedback or help prepping for an interview? Need a quiet place to work on job applications?
Stop by theCareer Studio, reopening August 28th!Located in Denney Hall, the studio offers drop-in hours for personalized, one-on-one support with no appointment needed.
🛠️ Resume & LinkedIn feedback🎤 Interview prep & elevator pitch coaching🎯 Major/career decision guidance🧠 Job and internship search strategy help
Open weekdays—come as you are, leave with a clearer plan.
